name: D. Fun with Integers
statement:
You are given a positive integer n greater or equal to 2. For every pair
of integers a and b (2
le |a|, |b|
le n), you can transform a into b if and only if there exists an integer
x such that 1 < |x| and (a
cdot x = b or b
cdot x = a), where |x| denotes the absolute value of x.After such a
transformation, your score increases by |x| points and you are to
transform a into b nor b into a anymore.Initially, you have a score of
0. You can start at any integer and transform it as many times as you
like. What is the maximum score you can achieve?
